data.title: Understanding Convolutions on Graphs
data.authors: Ameya Daigavane, Balaraman Ravindran, and Gaurav Aggarwal
data.description: Understanding the building blocks and design choices of graph neural networks.

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Graph Neural Networks
data.authors: Benjamin Sanchez-Lengeling, Emily Reif, Adam Pearce, and Alexander B. Wiltschko
data.description: What components are needed for building learning algorithms that leverage the structure and properties of graphs?

data.title: Distill Hiatus
data.authors: Editorial Team
data.description: After five years, Distill will be taking a break.

data.title: Multimodal Neurons in Artificial Neural Networks
data.authors: Gabriel Goh, Nick Cammarata †, Chelsea Voss †, Shan Carter, Michael Petrov, Ludwig Schubert, Alec Radford, and Chris Olah
data.description: We report the existence of multimodal neurons in artificial neural networks, similar to those found in the human brain.

data.title: Understanding RL Vision
data.authors: Jacob Hilton, Nick Cammarata, Shan Carter, Gabriel Goh, and Chris Olah
data.description: With diverse environments, we can analyze, diagnose and edit deep reinforcement learning models using attribution.

data.title: Communicating with Interactive Articles
data.authors: Fred Hohman, Matthew Conlen, Jeffrey Heer, and Duen Horng (Polo) Chau
data.description: Examining the design of interactive articles by synthesizing theory from disciplines such as education, journalism, and visualization.

data.title: Thread: Differentiable Self-organizing Systems
data.authors: Alexander Mordvintsev, Ettore Randazzo, Eyvind Niklasson, Michael Levin, and Sam Greydanus
data.description: A collection of articles and comments with the goal of understanding how to design robust and general purpose self-organizing systems.

data.title: Exploring Bayesian Optimization
data.authors: Apoorv Agnihotri and Nipun Batra
data.description: How to tune hyperparameters for your machine learning model using Bayesian optimization.

data.title: Visualizing Neural Networks with the Grand Tour
data.authors: Mingwei Li, Zhenge Zhao, and Carlos Scheidegger
data.description: By focusing on linear dimensionality reduction, we show how to visualize many dynamic phenomena in neural networks.

data.title: Thread: Circuits
data.authors: Nick Cammarata, Shan Carter, Gabriel Goh, Chris Olah, Michael Petrov, Ludwig Schubert, Chelsea Voss, Ben Egan, and Swee Kiat Lim
data.description: What can we learn if we invest heavily in reverse engineering a single neural network?

data.title: Visualizing the Impact of Feature Attribution Baselines
data.authors: Pascal Sturmfels, Scott Lundberg, and Su-In Lee
data.description: Exploring the baseline input hyperparameter, and how it impacts interpretations of neural network behavior.

data.title: Computing Receptive Fields of Convolutional Neural Networks
data.authors: André Araujo, Wade Norris, and Jack Sim
data.description: Detailed derivations and open-source code to analyze the receptive fields of convnets.

data.title: The Paths Perspective on Value Learning
data.authors: Sam Greydanus and Chris Olah
data.description: A closer look at how Temporal Difference Learning merges paths of experience for greater statistical efficiency

data.title: A Discussion of ‘Adversarial Examples Are Not Bugs, They Are Features’
data.authors: Logan Engstrom, Justin Gilmer, Gabriel Goh, Dan Hendrycks, Andrew Ilyas, Aleksander Madry, Reiichiro Nakano, Preetum Nakkiran, Shibani Santurkar, Brandon Tran, Dimitris Tsipras, and Eric Wallace
data.description: Six comments from the community and responses from the original authors

data.title: Open Questions about Generative Adversarial Networks
data.authors: Augustus Odena
data.description: What we'd like to find out about GANs that we don't know yet.

data.title: A Visual Exploration of Gaussian Processes
data.authors: Jochen Görtler, Rebecca Kehlbeck, and Oliver Deussen
data.description: How to turn a collection of small building blocks into a versatile tool for solving regression problems.

data.title: Visualizing memorization in RNNs
data.authors: Andreas Madsen
data.description: Inspecting gradient magnitudes in context can be a powerful tool to see when recurrent units use short-term or long-term contextual understanding.

data.title: Activation Atlas
data.authors: Shan Carter, Zan Armstrong, Ludwig Schubert, Ian Johnson, and Chris Olah
data.description: By using feature inversion to visualize millions of activations from an image classification network, we create an explorable activation atlas of features the network has learned and what concepts it typically represents.

data.title: AI Safety Needs Social Scientists
data.authors: Geoffrey Irving and Amanda Askell
data.description: If we want to train AI to do what humans want, we need to study humans.

data.title: Distill Update 2018
data.authors: Distill Editors
data.description: An Update from the Editorial Team

data.title: Differentiable Image Parameterizations
data.authors: Alexander Mordvintsev, Nicola Pezzotti, Ludwig Schubert, and Chris Olah
data.description: A powerful, under-explored tool for neural network visualizations and art.

data.title: Feature-wise transformations
data.authors: Vincent Dumoulin, Ethan Perez, Nathan Schucher, Florian Strub, Harm de Vries, Aaron Courville, and Yoshua Bengio
data.description: A simple and surprisingly effective family of conditioning mechanisms.

data.title: The Building Blocks of Interpretability
data.authors: Chris Olah, Arvind Satyanarayan, Ian Johnson, Shan Carter, Ludwig Schubert, Katherine Ye, and Alexander Mordvintsev
data.description: Interpretability techniques are normally studied in isolation. We explore the powerful interfaces that arise when you combine them -- and the rich structure of this combinatorial space.

data.title: Using Artificial Intelligence to Augment Human Intelligence
data.authors: Shan Carter and Michael Nielsen
data.description: By creating user interfaces which let us work with the representations inside machine learning models, we can give people new tools for reasoning.

data.title: Sequence Modeling with CTC
data.authors: Awni Hannun
data.description: A visual guide to Connectionist Temporal Classification, an algorithm used to train deep neural networks in speech recognition, handwriting recognition and other sequence problems.

data.title: Feature Visualization
data.authors: Chris Olah, Alexander Mordvintsev, and Ludwig Schubert
data.description: How neural networks build up their understanding of images

data.title: Why Momentum Really Works
data.authors: Gabriel Goh
data.description: We often think of optimization with momentum as a ball rolling down a hill. This isn't wrong, but there is much more to the story.

data.title: Research Debt
data.authors: Chris Olah and Shan Carter
data.description: Science is a human activity. When we fail to distill and explain research, we accumulate a kind of debt...

data.title: Experiments in Handwriting with a Neural Network
data.authors: Shan Carter, David Ha, Ian Johnson, and Chris Olah
data.description: Several interactive visualizations of a generative model of handwriting. Some are fun, some are serious.

data.title: Deconvolution and Checkerboard Artifacts
data.authors: Augustus Odena, Vincent Dumoulin, and Chris Olah
data.description: When we look very closely at images generated by neural networks, we often see a strange checkerboard pattern of artifacts.
